definitions: Either of the two times in the year when the sun reaches an equinox, resulting in the shortest day of the year (winter solstice) or the longest day of the year (summer solstice).
A turning point or a time of greatest intensity.
examples: The summer solstice is in June.
Winter solstice marks the shortest day.
It was a solstice in her career.
They celebrated the solstice with a feast.
